channel.title: Enviromental Variables! * Short Guide
channel.description:
[B]Hi. X power x here.[/B] [i]Im here to help everyone, whos having client issues , due to their enviromental variables. Enjoy![/i]
[u]Chapter 1: Locating.[/u] [i]Right click on My Computer. Press "properties". Than press the "Advanced" Tab. Look down a bit, and you will see , "Enviroment Variables". Press it.[/i][IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2qiz0vn.jpg[/img]
[u]Chapter 2: PATH variable.[/u] [i]Ok. Well on the top , is where to look. Make sure, it says.. Enviromental Variables for [b] * Computer USER . [/b] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/5tw5lh.jpg[/img] If you don't see the word... [b]PATH[/b] , than press "New..." and name it PATH. [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2uo2xax.jpg[/img]
[b]Variable Name: PATH Variable Value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk#.#.#_##\bin\ [/b]
The [B]##'s[/B]as being the version ( which can be found in the file Windows, or go to www.sun.com and test your system, for the recommended version. )
[u]Chapter 3: CLASSPATH variable. [/u] Next, as well as PATH variable, you need a .. [B]CLASSPATH[/B]. If you dont see it , press "New..." and do.. [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/sm4soo.jpg[/img]
[b]Variable Name: CLASSPATH Variable Value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk#.#.#_##\bin\ [/b] The [b]##'s[/b] as being the version (which can be found in the file Windows, or go to www.sun.com and test your system for your java version, or recommended java version. )[/i]
[u]Chapter 4: Finishing it up! [/u][IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/i3hz82.jpg[/img] [i]If you had downloaded the latest java version, and filled out the [b]###'s[/b] it should work sucessfully. Press "OKAY". And try running / compiling. If not, revise the guide. I kept it short, and simple, but good enough with detail for the guide to get through , and work. :) [/i]
[b]Hope you enjoyed. Best Regards, Elite (x power x).[/b]

item.title: Enviromental Variables! * Short Guide
item.dc:creator: @x_power_x x power x
item.description:
@x_power_x wrote:

Hi. X power x here.
Im here to help everyone, whos having client issues , due to their enviromental variables. Enjoy!

Chapter 1: Locating.
Right click on My Computer.
Press “properties”.
Than press the “Advanced” Tab.
Look down a bit, and you will see , “Enviroment Variables”. Press it.

Chapter 2: PATH variable.
[i]Ok. Well on the top , is where to look. Make sure, it says… Enviromental Variables for * Computer USER .
If you don’t see the word…
PATH , than press “New…” and name it PATH.

Variable Name: PATH
Variable Value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk#.#.#_##\bin\

The ##'sas being the version ( which can be found in the file Windows, or go to www.sun.com and test your system, for the recommended version. )

Chapter 3: CLASSPATH variable.
Next, as well as PATH variable, you need a …
CLASSPATH. If you dont see it , press “New…” and do…

Variable Name: CLASSPATH
Variable Value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk#.#.#_##\bin

The ##'s as being the version (which can be found in the file Windows, or go to www.sun.com and test your system for your java version, or recommended java version. )[/i]

Chapter 4: Finishing it up!
If you had downloaded the latest java version, and filled out the ###'s it should work sucessfully. Press “OKAY”. And try running / compiling. If not, revise the guide. I kept it short, and simple, but good enough with detail for the guide to get through , and work.

Hope you enjoyed.
Best Regards,
Elite (x power x).

Read full topic
